description: Number of steps for trajectory of n to reach 1 under the map that sends x -> x/13 if x mod 13 = 0, x -> 14x+13-(x mod 13) if x is not 0 mod 13 (for a 2nd time when n starts at 1).
comments: This sequence is generated by the program below for m=13,p=14. Other values of m and p also converge but not necessarily to 1. For m =2 and p=1 we have the count of steps for the x+1 problem. m=prime and p=m+1 usually converge to 1 but break down for certain values of n. E.g. 17 locks at n=34, 23 at n=49, 29 at n=91. I verified m=13 for n up to 100000. 100000 requires 100 steps to reach 1.
links: Harvey P. Dale, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
prog: (PARI) countxp2(n,m,p) = { c=1; x=1; x=x*p+m-1; while(x>1, r = x%m; if(r==0,x=x/m,x=x*p+m-r); c++; ); print1(c" "); for(j=2,n, x=j; c=0; while(x>1, r = x%m; if(r==0,x=x/m,x=x*p+m-r); c++; \ print1(x" "); ); print1(c" ") ) }
